page.title: 20CHANGING TIMES IN COCKFIELD2
page.content: We asked Mr.White what were the greatest changes that had taken place since 1945 in this part of Cockfield and in the lives of the residents.He said that the coming of piped water to replace well water and the coming of electricity to replace oil lamps and candles.Washing powders and washing machines had made ladies' lives much easier.The gardens were much neater and there were far more lawns now with most people owning lawn mowers.In those times 40 years ago children were lucky if they had 1 penny pocket money. We also asked Mr.White if he would like to go back to those times and he said "No". There was too much hard work to do in the house and there were many really poor families then,whose children had poor food and little of it.Children played with iron and wood hoops,spinning tops and marbles.
